newsitem.title: NORWAY: Bergesen sees profits improve in 1997.
newsitem.headline: Bergesen sees profits improve in 1997.

text.p: Norway's largest shipping company Bergesen ASA said on Thursday it expected full-year 1997 pre-tax profits to be higher than in 1996.
The company booked a profit before tax of 380 million crowns for the full-year 1996, down 22 percent from 489 million crowns in 1995.

"It is the company's opinion that the gas market has reached its bottom and Bergesen expects a positive development in the future," it said in a statement. "This improvement will not have full effect in 1997, which is expected to show results in line with 1996."
Tankers was forecast to improve profits this year based on continued growth in oil consumption and a small order book. Dry bulk was expected to provide a result on par with 1996.
"Overall, Bergesen expects an improvement in net profit before tax in 1997 compared to 1996," the company said.
